conclusion: Determine the maximum value of the electromotive force (EMF) generated by the AC generator using given information.
The number of turns is m = 100, resistance r = 10 Ohm, resistance R = 90 Ohm, and magnetic flux variation with time is shown in the figure.
From the figure, the maximum magnetic flux is given as Phi_max = 2.0 x 10^-2 Wb.
Calculate the angular frequency omega using the time period T from the figure: omega = 100 rad/s.
Determine the maximum induced EMF E_max using the formula E_max = m Phi_max omega, resulting in E_max = 200 V.
The back EMF E_b in the coil is given by the derivative of magnetic flux with respect to time.
The magnetic flux Phi as a function of time t is Phi(t) = Phi_max sin(omega t).
Calculate the rate of change of magnetic flux: dPhi/dt = Phi_max omega cos(omega t).
Determine the maximum value of the back EMF: E_b,max = Phi_max omega = 2.0 V.
The total EMF in the circuit is approximately the same as the maximum induced EMF since the back EMF is much smaller.
The maximum value of the electromotive force generated by the alternating current generator is 200 V.
